intro: Australina septemdentata, commonly known as the seven-toothed heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in heathlands and dry forests. It is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and can withstand drought conditions. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an important species in local ecosystems.
